Metadata.Title: Ask User Permission Before Using Geopositioning
Metadata.DirectLink: Ask User Permission Before Using Geopositioning

Content.Data:
==Applies To==
* HTML5
==What to Do==
Ask the user for permission before calling getCurrentPosition or watchPosition.
==Why==
Ask the user for permission before using geopositioning functionality to avoid privacy issues.
==How==
To ask the user for permission before calling geopositioning functions:
# **Determine if the application uses geopositioning.** Search the application code for use of the getCurrentPosition and watchPosition functions to determine whether the application uses geopositioning. Create a spreadsheet to list each piece of code that calls these functions. # **Write a message asking the user for permission to use geopositioning.** If the application uses geopositioning functions, write a polite message explaining to the user the benefits of using them, and asking for permission to use these functions. # **Ask the user for permission to use geopositioning.** For each piece of code that uses getCurrentPosition and/or watchPosition functions, add code that displays the message from the previous step. Add a conditional statement that only executes code that uses getCurrentPosition and/or watchPosition functions if the user has granted permission to do so.
